NAME: Burton 1
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f4\fswiss\fprq2 System;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Brewing & Malting Science", 1:206, Hough et al.  \par Very hard brewing water, perfect for brown ales and the original British pale ales.\par }

NAME: Burton 2
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f4\fswiss\fprq2 System;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Pale Ale", p58, Foster. Very hard brewing water, perfect for brown ales and the original British pale ales.\par }

NAME: Burton 3
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f4\fswiss\fprq2 System;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: Papazian, Homebrewer's Companion.  Very hard brewing water, perfect for brown ales and the original British pale ales.\par }

NAME: Dortmund 1
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f2\fs16 Source: "Brewing Lager Beer", p55, Noonan.  The home of Dortmunder Union and other German lagers.\par }

NAME: Dortmund 2
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source:  Papazian, Homebrewer's Companion.\par }

NAME: Dublin 1
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "American Handy Book", 2:790, Wahl-Henius, 1902.  The home of stout, use this type of water for dark, dry ales.\par }

NAME: Dublin 2
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: Al Korzonas.\par }

NAME: Edinburgh 1
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Fermentation Technology", p. 13, Westermann and Huige. The water of Scottish style beers and barley wines.\par }

NAME: Edinburgh 2
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: Papazian, Homebrewer's Companion.\par }

NAME: Koln
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: Bob Bloodworth, HBD 26 Jan 95.\par }

NAME: London City
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Fermentation Technology", p. 13, Westermann and Huige.  The home of porter, London water is relatively soft, good for all British style ales.\par }

NAME: London Well
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Fermentation Technology", p. 13, Westermann and Huige.\par }

NAME: Munich
DESCR: The famous brewing city of Munich has good water for bocks, dunkles, and dark lagers.

NAME: Pilsen
DESCR: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deftab720{\fonttbl{\f0\fswiss MS Sans Serif;}{\f1\froman\fcharset2 Symbol;}{\f2\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}{\f3\fswiss\fcharset1 MS Sans Serif;}}{\colortbl\red0\green0\blue0;}\deflang1033\pard\plain\f3\fs16 Source: "Brewing Lager Beer", p55, Noonan.  Very soft water, ideal for accentuating soft bitterness of Czech pilsners.\par }

NAME: Vienna
DESCR: Good target water for light and gold lagers, such as Viennas or Maerzens.
